com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.network
Class ServerClient

java.lang.Object
  ListenerClient
      com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.network.ServerClient

public final class ServerClient
extends ListenerClient

Provides synchronized access to the task queue across JVMs via sockets

Version:
$Id: ServerClient.java 1165 2010-10-28 22:52:14Z derek@battams.ca $
Author:
dbattams

Constructor Detail

ServerClient

public ServerClient()
             throws java.io.IOException

Constructor; will connect to the SJQ server running on the SageTV server this app is associated with

If called outside the Sage JVM then it is expected that the sagex-api RMI provider has been properly configured before calling this constructor

Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there was an error making the socket connection to the SJQ server
Method Detail

finalize

protected void finalize()

close

public void close()

addTask

public long addTask(java.lang.String taskId,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env)
             throws java.io.IOException
Add a new task to the task queue

Parameters:
taskId - The task id to be added
env - The map of env vars to be attached to the task's runtime env; can be empty, but not null
Returns:
The task queue id assigned to the newly inserted task
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown if there was an error adding the task to the task queue

deleteTask

public boolean deleteTask(long queueId)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Delete a task from the task queue

Parameters:
queueId - The unique task queue id number to be deleted
Returns:
True if the task was deleted or false otherwise; only tasks in WAITING, RETURNED, or FAILED state can be deleted, any other state will cause false to be returned
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown if there were fatal errors with the network connection to the SJQ engine socket

deleteClient

public boolean deleteClient(Client clnt)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Delete a registered task client

Parameters:
clnt - The client to be deleted
Returns:
True on success or false otherwise; you cannot delete a task client if it is currently running tasks, false will be returned if you try to do so
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getActiveQueue

public QueuedTask[] getActiveQueue()
Get the list of active tasks in the queue; a task is active if it's in WAITING, RETURNED or RUNNING state

Returns:
The array of active tasks; can be empty in case of error, but never null

getAllClients

public Client[] getAllClients()
Get all the registered clients

Returns:
The array of registered task clients

getClient

public Client getClient(java.lang.String host,
                        int port)
Get a client by host/port

Parameters:
host - The hostname of the client to get
port - The port the client is listening on
Returns:
The Client or null if the client is not registered

saveClient

public boolean saveClient(Client clnt)
Register a new task client or update an existing client

Parameters:
clnt - The client to register/update
Returns:
True if the registration/update succeeded or false otherwise

getRegisteredTaskIds

public java.lang.String[] getRegisteredTaskIds()
Get the list of all registered task ids

Returns:
The array of all registered task ids, may be empty in case of error but never null

killTask

public boolean killTask(QueuedTask qt)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Kill the given task on the task agent that is running it

Parameters:
qt - The task to be killed
Returns:
True if the signal was sent successfully or false otherwise; this is an asynchronous command, the return value does not represent if a task was actually killed only if the signal to kill was successfully sent
Throws:
java.io.IOException - In case of network comm issues

killAllTasks

public boolean killAllTasks(Client clnt)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Kill all running tasks on the given task client

Parameters:
clnt - The task client to kill all active tasks on
Returns:
True on successful request, false otherwise; this is an asynchronous command so the return value does not signify if any tasks were actually killed
Throws:
java.io.IOException - In case of network comm errors

pingTaskClient

public boolean pingTaskClient(Client clnt)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Request the server pings the given client and updates its status

Parameters:
clnt - The Client to be pinged by the server
Returns:
True on success or false otherwise; this is an asynchronous command; the return value only denotes if the request was received by the server, it doesn't represent the final status of the ping
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there are network comm errors

getMetadataForTask

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getMetadataForTask(QueuedTask qt)
Return the metadata map associated with the given QueuedTask

Parameters:
qt - The task to get metadata for
Returns:
The task's metadata. An empty map is returned if the task has no metadata.

getAllRegisteredTasks

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Collection<Task>> getAllRegisteredTasks()
Get a map of all registered tasks; the keys of the map are the task client the task is registered to

Returns:
The map of registered tasks, keyed by Client.getDescription()
